N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 664.4 - Plant retired for nonrecurring factors not recognized in depreciation rates

State Regulations
(a) A retirement
will be considered as nonrecurring (extraordinary) only if the following
criteria are met: (1)

The impending retirement
was not adequately considered in setting past depreciation rates. (2)

The charging of the retirement against
the reserve will unduly deplete that reserve. (3)

The retirement is unusual such that
similar retirements are not likely to recur in the future. (b) Upon direction or approval from this
commission, the company shall credit account 3100, Accumulated Depreciation, and charge account 1438, Deferred Maintenance and Retirements, with the
unprovided-for loss in service value. Such amounts shall be distributed from
account 1438 to account 6561, Depreciation Expense--Telecommunications Plant in

Service, or account 6562, Depreciation Expense--Property Held for Future

Telecommunications Use, over such period as this commission may direct or
approve. Notes
